column4: cyphase: gnome and os x, and even kde now are starting to get this mentality
well, osx first. then gnome fell, and kde is going to start falling
have you seen some gnome 1.x apps?
old gnome-terminal is actually more useful than the new one
that's not really the same thing as what i was talking about
you used to have to use the command line to edit menus in gnome2

i'm talking about someone wanting to be able to, for example, easily share a printer with windows machines through samba, and being told "you can already do that. just edit this file and that file, and run these commands.."
well, konqueror already has a way to manage that
but do you see my point?
yeah, there are a lot of things that just haven't been added to any GUI
sometimes they are an oversight, other times when it goes 8 or so years without... THEN you can pretty much say they don't care
for instance Konqueror has NEVER gotten xslt handling for... 7 years
that's just laziness (not to be mean to the konqueror devs)
it's worse than laziness, people have spent more time arguing than it would have been taken to add the proper libmagic and set associations
